poem:
Title: To the Sweetheart Plant

Unseen valentines, veined,
in your green-heart splendor,
a quiet proclamation of devotion.
Thriving in measured light,
adorning barren tables — you gift
unspoken verses of love. 

Close to northern sunbeams,
your simple, succulent grace, a testament
to gentle affection, unfurling 
in each verdant spectrum,
Bathing in your silence — 
we find words to friendship's song.
